intro: Macrosamanea pubiramea var. pubiramea, commonly known as the hairy macrococcus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its woody, shrub-like structure with thick, fleshy stems and leaves that are covered in fine, hairy pubescence. The plant produces large, showy flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. It is native to tropical regions of South America and is often found in humid, lowland areas. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
